annual crop land: varying plant heights depending on growth stage
possibly farm equipment or irrigation systems
green, yellow, or brown plants depending on the season and crop type
forest: possibly features like streams or rivers
natural elements like soil, rocks, and fallen leaves
wildlife such as birds, insects, or mammals
brushland or shrubland: limited or irregular patches of taller plants
may have grassy areas interspersed with shrubs
sparse or scattered distribution of shrubs or small trees
subject to seasonal changes in appearance, with stress indicating rainfall patterns
highway or road: lane markings, such as white or yellow lines
absence of vegetation in the primary travel paths
industrial buildings or commercial build: HVAC systems or other industrial equipment visible on the roof
multiple windows, often large (common in commercial buildings)
signage with company names or logos
loading docks or large entry doors (common in industrial buildings)
pasture land: Sometimes includes a barn or a shelter for animals
Presence of grazing animals such as cows, sheep, or horses
Fencing that may outline the pasture area
Sparse or few trees and bushes
permanent crop land: signs of agricultural activity such as machinery or workers
absence of crop rotation or seasonal changes
rows or patterns of planted crops
river: Reflective surface that can range from calm to turbulent
Various shades of blue, green, or brown
Sometimes animals or people interacting with the water
Varying widths and depths along its course
lake or sea: waves or ripples on the surface
presence of boats, buoys, or other watercraft
